title: Requires passenger cabs be inspected for carbon monoxide levels and requires information on warning signs of such to be distributed with each operator's license
summary: Requires passenger cabs be inspected for unsafe carbon monoxide levels and requires information on the warning signs of carbon monoxide poisoning to be distributed with each operator's license, issued or renewed.

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and  traffic  law,  in  relation  to  carbon
         monoxide poisoning

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subparagraph (a) of  paragraph  1  of  subdivision  (c)  of
    2  section  301  of the vehicle and traffic law, as amended by section 5 of
    3  part V1 of chapter 62 of the  laws  of  2003,  is  amended  to  read  as
    4  follows:
    5    (a)  A  safety  inspection  shall  be made with respect to the brakes;
    6  steering mechanism; wheel alignment; lights, including but  not  limited
    7  to the lights which are designed and placed on a vehicle for the purpose
    8  of  illuminating  the vehicle's license plates; odometer; tire pressure;
    9  seat safety belts; shoulder harness safety belts; EXHAUST SYSTEM FOR THE
   10  PURPOSES OF ENSURING THAT CARBON MONOXIDE LEVELS IN THE CAB OF THE VEHI-
   11  CLE HAVE NOT REACHED UNSAFE LEVELS IN EXCESS OF 70 PARTS PER MILLION and
   12  such other mechanisms and  equipment  as  shall  be  determined  by  the
   13  commissioner  to  be  necessary  for  proper  and  safe operations. Such
   14  inspection shall also be made with  respect  to  vehicle  identification
   15  number.  Upon inspection, the mileage appearing on the odometer shall be
   16  recorded upon the inspection sticker.
   17    S 2. The vehicle and traffic law is amended by adding  a  new  section
   18  397-c to read as follows:
   19    S  397-C. EDUCATION AGAINST DANGERS OF CARBON MONOXIDE POISONING.  THE
   20  COMMISSIONER, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE CHAIR OF THE CONSUMER  PROTECTION
   21  BOARD, SHALL PREPARE AND DISTRIBUTE WITH EACH OPERATOR'S LICENSE, WHETH-
   22  ER ISSUED OR RENEWED, A PAMPHLET ON THE WARNING SIGNS OF CARBON MONOXIDE
   23  POISONING  AND THE APPROPRIATE ACTIONS TO BE TAKEN TO PREVENT SUCH ACCI-
   24  DENTAL POISONING.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
